## Functions

### appendToError() {#addbdfe8987613dd5333f796f9cfcaf6c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Error llvm::ifs::anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;ELFObjHandler.cpp&#125;::appendToError (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> Err, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> After)</>}>
This function takes an error, and appends a string of text to the end of that error.

Since &quot;appending&quot; to an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> isn&#39;t supported behavior of an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a>, this function technically creates a new error with the combined message and consumes the old error.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Err">Source error.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="After">Text to append at the end of Err&#39;s error message.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/interfacestub/elfobjhandler-cpp/#l00346">346</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/interfacestub/elfobjhandler-cpp">ELFObjHandler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
